en.purpose: To calculate the estimated body surface area based on the Mosteller formula.
en.use:
Use the most recent height and weight measurements to ensure accuracy.

Use in conjunction with other assessments and patient history.

Use of this formula is less precise for neonates and infants, as well as for individuals at extreme values of height and weight.

The formula expresses BSA in squared meters (m2) and uses a person's weight in kilograms (kg) and height/length in centimeters (cm), in accordance with: (Height(cm) x Weight(kg) / 3600 ) ^½. 

Aids in calculating dosages for medications, such as chemotherapy, and measuring cardiac index.
en.misuse: Not to be used for calculating BSA based on other formulas.

other_details.references: Mosteller RD. Simplified calculation of body-surface area. N Engl J Med. 1987 Oct 22;317(17):1098. doi: 10.1056/NEJM198710223171717. PMID: 3657876.
other_details.en: To calculate body surface area using the Mosteller formula.

gt0001.text: Body Surface Area (BSA) calculation - Mosteller formula
gt0001.description: Body Surface Area (BSA) is an estimation of individual's total external surface area. It can be calculated using several formulas and in this guideline it is calculated using the Mosteller formula.

gt0005.description: The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
